Node.definition: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= man; ◄ from the land of Uz (עוּץ) ► main character of book of Job

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= marker expressing a speaker's confirmation of the truth of a statement; in some cases the truth of this statement is conceded
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief |literally: heart; hence: = the ability to think for oneself as opposed to being easily swayed by what others say or do
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which people lose some of their status
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
literally: (object of) laughter; hence: = a person or group who has to endure lack of respect from others, often accompanied by laughter
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
literally: (object of) laughter; hence: = a person or group who has to endure lack of respect from others, often accompanied by laughter
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions
= process by which humans reflect on the things that they perceive
= state in which humans live a peaceful life and have nothing to fear, which can easily lead to carelessness and arrogance
= member of an unidentified clan
literally: foot; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside

Node.gloss: to ravage|to devastate|to lay waster|to plunder
Node.definition: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process
= state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH
= causative action by which humans provoke deities to anger
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations|= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
literally: hand; hence: = action by which humans or deities exert strength and power
= marker indicating that the information that follows is in contrast with what has preceded
often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to humans (אָדָם) birds (עֹוף) reptiles (רֶמֶשׂ) insects (שֶׁרֶץ) and fish (דָּג)
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire knowledge, a skill, or a certain type of behavior

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
= particle linking two entities by which Y is added to X as an additional option
= action by which humans utter words with the focus on what is said

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire knowledge, a skill, or a certain type of behavior

Node.gloss: to tell|to recount|to proclaim: to declare
Node.definition: = action by which humans communicate verbally to others about an event or situation, with focus on the contents rather than on the speech act

= collective designation of various cold blooded, aquatic vertebrates, having gills, usually fins, and typically an elongated body covered with scales; or, in a loosely sense, any of various other aquatic animals; ► an important source of food
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= state in which humans and deities are alive and well, ◄ which, for humans, requires the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

= the air that is taken in and expelled through the lungs by humans and animals, which makes them live, and which distinguishes them from inanimate objects like idols; ≈ regarded as coming from God; sometimes God is depicted as a breathing being as well
= living creature, including both humans and animals; ◄ conceived as an object that mainly consists of flesh; ≈ regarded as weak and passing
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= action by which humans try to determine whether the words spoken by others are true and reliable, ◄ as a goldsmith tests the quality of a precious metal by smelting it in the fire
= mouth cavity; ◄ part of human body; ► plays an important role in actions like speaking, blowing, kissing, biting, tasting, and chewing
= any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth
= process by which the flavor of food is perceived, when eating
= state in which humans are advanced in age; ≈ often associated with wisdom and respectability
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
literally: length of days; hence: = an extended period of time
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= the ability to accomplish great things because of characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

Node.gloss: to tear down|to demolish|to ruin|to raze|to overthrow
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone tears down a construction
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

Node.gloss: to shut in|to shut up|to imprison
Node.definition: = action of restricting or containing a person or an object to a specific space
= causative action by which humans and deities release a prisoner

Node.gloss: to withhold|to prevent|to keep from|to stop from|to close
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities keep people or objects from activities that they are normally involved in
= process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause

Node.gloss: to let go|to dismiss|to send (someone) on his way|to free|to release
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities allow (other) humans to leave a certain place and go home
= causative action by which humans or deities destroy an object completely ◄ as if by turning it completely upside down

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= state in which a person, supernatural being, animal, substance, or force has the ability to exert great force
= action by which humans act wrongly, though without the intention to do so
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to act wrongly
= causative action or process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or objects to move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= a person whose official role and responsibility it is to give advice to someone in authority
= causative action by which deities or humans cause (other) humans to either become fools or look like fools

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

literally: to ungird (someone's) correction; hence: = causative action by which deities remove humans from a position of authority, ◄ as if that authority was symbolized by the belt around their waist
= to attach a strip of cloth to someone else's body; ≈ associated with low status
= piece of cloth ► wrapped around the waist to cover the private parts; commonly worn by slaves; ≈ associated with low status

= the two sides of the body of humans and certain animals between the rib cage and the hips, ► which is the place where people normally tie a girdle, breeches, loincloth, or sackcloth; ≈ a symbol of strength
= causative action or process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or objects to move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= state of not being subject to change

Node.gloss: to be faithful|to be reliable|to be trustworthy|to be true
Node.definition: = state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions
literally: (good) taste; hence: = state in which humans act with good judgment

= a council or a group of older men who act with authority on behalf of or over their people; some represent an entire nation, others manage the affairs at the town level; some provide their leader with counsel; involved in both judicial and military decisions, and participating in cultic ceremonies; ≈ expected to be wise and considered worthy of deference and respect
literally: to pour out (an attitude); hence: = causative action by which deities cause something to happen to others in abundance
= state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions
= member of the nobility; ≈ associated with authority; expected to be generous, reliable, and just
= strip ◄ of leather ► worn around the waist of a fighting man, and the place where he ties his sword; ≈ associated with the strength to fight
= person with military and/or political strength
= causative action by which a deity or human being causes certain information to become available to someone else

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion
literally: to bring to light; hence: = causative process by which deities cause something that was previously hidden to become fully visible

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

literally: shadow of death, only found in poetry; hence: = state in which there is a total absence of light ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer to distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, fear, death, and oblivion
= causative process by which deities causes a nation to be regarded with respect

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: head; hence: = the person in leadership of a group of people, or, by extension, the most important object among a set of objects

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= location that is devoid of any life and without any structure or order

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives
= action by which humans examine a place or object by touching ◄ usually as a result of being unable to see

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= state in which humans are intoxicated ◄ as a result of having had too much alcohol
